title: How to Cook Fenugreek

steps.headline: Grind the seeds to add the flavor without cooking the seeds.
steps.description: Fenugreek seeds are quite hard, so it can be difficult to grind them by hand with a mortar and pestle. Instead, put the seeds in a small coffee grinder and let the machine do the work for you. You can also try to buy fenugreek seeds that are already ground up, directly from the store.

steps.headline: Dry roast the seeds on the stove for a more edible addition to your dish.
steps.description: Heat up a pan and pour in your desired amount of fenugreek seeds, but don’t add any cooking oil. Cook them on medium heat for a few minutes until the seeds become clearly browned. During the process, be sure to flip the seeds around so that both sides are browned. This will give you some nicely cooked seeds that will add flavor and texture to your dish.

steps.headline: Keep raw seeds in an airtight container in a cool, dark place.
steps.description: Store your uncooked fenugreek seeds in the back of your pantry/cupboard, or in another location that will remain cool all year long. You should also place them somewhere that is out of direct sunlight. If stored properly, raw fenugreek seeds can keep for up to one year. Avoid storing cooked fenugreek seeds. Once the seed has been cooked or roasted, it’ll only be a short period of time before it goes mushy on you.

steps.headline: Purchase small amounts so you won’t have to store them for long.
steps.description: In order to promote freshness in your culinary creations, it’s best to buy fenugreek seeds when you need them and avoid storing them for longer periods of time. Over time, they lose their tangy flavor and won’t be as effective and tasty in the food you make. You can usually find fenugreek seeds at Indian specialty stores.

steps.headline: Make berbere, an Ethiopian spice mix.
steps.description: Berbere is a common Ethiopian spice mixture, but it can often be difficult to find in other parts of the world. It is often used in doro wat, a chicken dish. Make your own by mixing all the ingredients together in a bowl and stirring thoroughly. When stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator, your berbere seasoning will keep for about 3 months.

methods.name: Making Indian Chicken Curry with Fenugreek

steps.headline: Heat the olive oil and brown a finely chopped onion in the pan.
steps.description: Add 4 tablespoons of olive oil to a pan and put it on medium heat. Once the oil is heated, add 1 medium onion that has been finely chopped and fry it for 10 minutes, or until it is lightly browned. Add 1 teaspoon of crushed garlic and 1 teaspoon of finely grated ginger, then continue frying for an additional 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Brown the chicken in the pan, then add the tomatoes and chiles.
steps.description: Add 700 g (1.5 lb) of boneless, skinless chicken thighs (cut into small 2 cm (0.79 in) chunks) to the pan and brown the chicken for 2 minutes. Then add 4 tablespoons of canned chopped tomatoes and 3 finely chopped green chiles. Stir the pan for 2 minutes, then add 1 teaspoon of turmeric and ½ teaspoon of salt.

steps.headline: Cook the chicken for 5 minutes, then add the seasonings.
steps.description: Let the mixture continue cooking on medium heat for 5 minutes. Keep stirring/mixing during this time. Then add ¼ teaspoon of chili powder, 1 teaspoon of garam masala, and 1 ½ tablespoons of dried fenugreek leaves or ground seeds.

steps.headline: Add some hot water and cook the dish on low heat for 20 minutes.
steps.description: Mix in some hot water – just enough to cover the chicken – and bring the heat down to a simmer. Cover the entire thing and cook it on low heat for 20 minutes. Make sure the chicken is properly cooked before serving. If there is any pinkness to the meat, you’ll want to continue cooking it for 5-10 more minutes.

steps.headline: Freeze fresh or dried fenugreek leaves.
steps.description: If you have fenugreek leaves that you want to hold onto for a while, you can simply stick them in the freezer to lengthen their shelf-life. Place them in an airtight container in the freezer. This works for either fresh or dried fenugreek leaves. Frozen leaves can last for up to a month in the freezer.

steps.headline: Add the leaves to a salad as additional flavoring.
steps.description: In addition to the large seeds, fenugreek plants have fragrant, flavorful leaves that can be used in cooking as well. You can simply wash them and add them to a salad for a tangy, bitter taste. The leaves also make a nice garnish for a salad or other dish.

steps.headline: Add fenugreek leaves to a soup.
steps.description: You can also add fenugreek leaves to soups and other curry-type dish as flavoring. Use them similar to basil leaves – you add them to the dish while cooking to infuse the flavor. Then you are free to eat them or leave them after. This method also works for other curry-type dishes that you cook for a prolonged period of time because the flavor of the leaves will seep into the dish as the cooking occurs.
